title: Astounding Science Fiction v41n1
creator: Street and Smith Publications
description: Astounding Science Fiction , Volume 41 Number 1, March of 1948. Published by Street & Smith Publications,  Inc., New York, NY. 164 pages. Cover art by Alejandro de Cañedo. Edited by John W. Campbell, Jr. Featuring essays by John W. Campbell, Jr. as The Editor,  L. Sprague de Camp and Willy Ley in a book review for PILGRIMS THROUGH SPACE AND TIME: A HISTORY AND ANALYSIS OF SCIENCE FICTION by J. O. Bailey. The Brass Tacks column includes a letter from author J. J. Coupling in response to an essay about the patent system, while the Analytic Lab reports that E. E. Smith's Children of Lens Part 3 was the second highest rated story in the January 1948 issue. Includes the following works of fiction: ...And Searching Mind (Part 1 of 3, Humanoids series 2). a serial by Jack Williamson. The Incredible Invasion, a shortstory by George O. Smith. West Wind, a novelette by Murray Leinster. The Endochronic Properties of Resublimated Thiotimoline (Thiotimoline Part 1 of 4), a shortstory by Isaac Asimov. Her Majesty's Aberration, an Ole Doc Methuselah shortstory by L. Ron Hubbard. Film of Death, a shortstory by John Scott Campbell as by J. Scott Campbell.
